intro: Acer macropterum, commonly known as the Chinese maple, is a deciduous tree native to eastern Asia. It is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and palmate leaves that turn vibrant shades of red and orange in autumn. The tree produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in early spring, followed by winged seeds that are dispersed by the wind. It typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters and thrives in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and parks.
